entry.title: What is the order in which the status is sorted while using Status,LogEnd desc filter
entry.content:
I am retrieving the status of the MPL through the API. I want to check if a particluar iflow is completed.

We have been using the following query :

/api/v1/MessageProcessingLogs?$filter=IntegrationFlowName%20eq%20%27IFLOWNAME%27%20and%20LogStart%20gt%20datetime%272025-09-01T11:59:31.658%27&$top=1

This sometimes do not retrieve the 'Completed' status at all.

So I have added order by LogEnd desc. This was going smooth until at for an iflow the Completed timestamp is 5:44:07 and DISCARDED timestamp is 5:44:10, my code kept picking the DISCARDED status and there was no way it is going to retrieve the details of the COMPLETED logs.

On further analysis I found there is this filter option to orderBy: Status,LogEnd desc

I want to know how this filter works, which status gets the precedence in this filter. 

If I have Completed and Abandoned status , and Abandoned is the latest which one will be retrieved as Top 1 while using this?

Thanks,

entry.title: Multiple Purchase order and Invoices per SBU
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently facing a challenge with a SAP Business ByDesign tenant that consists of about 20 SBUs.

The issue is that these SBUs share certain general suppliers who provide services across the entire group. The supplier’s total charge is a lump sum, which is then internally allocated to each SBU either equally or based on an agreed percentage.

At present, each SBU independently creates its own Purchase Order for the same supplier, followed by a Goods and Services Receipt, Supplier Invoice, and payment. This means that for a single service, 20 separate Purchase Orders and related postings are created. The same process is repeated for each group-wide supplier, and in cases where there are over 10 such suppliers, the process becomes highly repetitive and time-consuming.

This repetitive effort is slowing down procurement operations.

Our question is:

Is there a way in SAP Business ByDesign to streamline this process so that the effort is not duplicated across all SBUs?

If not, what would be the recommended best-practice approach?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Down Payment with partial deliveries
entry.content:
Hello Lakshmipathi.

Thanks for your reply. I got below answer from SAP:

"Dear Christophe, What you are trying to achieve is a kind of mix of both supported scenarios. You are trying to invoice deliveries that were created with reference to a sales order, that contains a billing plan, where FAZ invoices were created.

In this regards, I would like to ask you to read note 0002714746 - 'Down payment clearing and delivered quantity', mainly the following part: ... The down payment request invoice (FAZ) relates only to the billing plan item entered in the sales document. In the case of value-based entry, this is independent of all other data. In the case of percentage-based entry, its value relates only to the net value of the sales document or sales document item. This means that there is never a reference to the delivery, so the delivered quantity cannot be taken into account. ...

Hence, both scenarios cannot be mixed.

Standard sales down payment process only supports the following scenarios:

- Down payment with billing plan, where AZWR pricing condition is used, sales order and FAZ invoice are required;

- Condition based down payment, where AZWA and AZWB conditions are used and invoice is created with reference to delivery.

If you want to work with down payments in SD module, one of the scenarios above should be used."

entry.title: Re: How the capacity planning works in warehouse manageme...

Yes at Storage type level only, you need to configure.

Check in SSCUI Define Storage Types where you can activate Capacity Check Active. This enables the system to evaluate Maximum weight, Maximum volume & Maximum number of quants or products. However, this check applies collectively to all bins within the storage type—not individually per bin. If your requirement is per bin, I am not sure whether any standard option is available.

You can find the configuration flow in SAP’s learning journey here

entry.title: How to send XML file to an Aplink printer via ABAP in SAP?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a scenario where I need to send print commands to an Aplink printer, which receives XML files according to the manufacturer’s manual.

I was able to test this successfully using Python, by opening a TCP/IP socket and sending the XML to the printer’s IP/port. Example:

 

 
import socket s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.connect(("192.168.3.5", 9800)) s.sendall(xml.encode("utf-8"))
 

Now I would like to know:

  • How could I implement something similar directly in SAP via ABAP?

  • Is there any standard function/class (SOCKET, HTTP, etc.) that can be used to open the TCP/IP connection and send the XML?

  • Or would the best practice be to use SAP PI/PO/Middleware to handle this communication?

    The goal is:

    • Generate the XML within SAP (order/note data).

    • Send this XML from ABAP to the network printer (IP/port).

    • If possible, receive the printer’s response to validate the print job.

      Thanks in advance for any guidance or implementation examples 🙏

entry.title: Re: Quality Custom field data flow in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Raj

To achieve recording a custom Quality Heat Number during Usage Decision and have it flow into apps like Stock - Multiple Materials or MMBE in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the recommended approach is:

  1. Publish a Custom Field in Usage Decision:
    Extend the Usage Decision business context by creating and publishing a custom field (Quality Heat Number) via the Custom Fields and Logic app or Key User Extensibility.
  2. Ensure Field Propagation to stock and relevant Apps:
    • Currently, standard Stock apps (e.g., Stock - Multiple Materials, MMBE) use core inventory and material stock data, which usually does not include specific Quality Management fields like the Heat Number unless explicitly modelled.
    • To flow the custom field data to stock-level apps, you likely need to extend related CDS views or data sources underlying these apps or build custom analytical content/apps that join Usage Decision data with stock data.
  3. Alternative or complementary solutions:
    • Use SAP Quality Management (QM) features to capture detailed inspection lot data including extensions for Heat Number.
    • Utilize Advanced Track and Trace or batch management features if applicable to store and track Heat Numbers at the material batch level, which integrates with stock and usage decision processes.
    • Check if the business context or extension scenarios for Quality Inspection Results or Usage Decision allow mapping this field end-to-end.
  4. Business Context & Extensibility:
    • Explore the Business Context "Usage Decision" in the Extension apps to see if the custom field can be propagated via extension scenarios for Consumption, Stock, or QM data.
    • If stock apps do not support direct extension for this field, consider building a custom Fiori app or dashboard that combines Quality Heat Number data with stock for the user.

Kindly consult the following references for more details:

SAP blog on Quality Management in S/4HANA Cloud 2502

S/4HANA extensibility for custom fields and business context propagation

This approach ensures data consistency and adherence to cloud extension best practices, allowing the heat number value to be captured at inspection and made visible where needed in stock or reporting apps.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: EPPM專案關閉作業
entry.content:
Hello @MartinJou 

Thank you for your question. Based on the context of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, this question pertains to SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

For a Project with revenue, you must adhere to the settlement rule before the project can be formally closed.

  • Purpose: The settlement rule clearly instructs the system to transfer all project-related costs and revenues to their final financial destinations, such as a cost center, fixed asset, or profitability account segment.
  • Effect: This action guarantees that the project's financial balance is reduced to zero. It is a required prerequisite for formal project closure from a financial standpoint and for ensuring precise company-wide financial reporting.

This process is a typical step in the project lifecycle within SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

For more detailed information, please refer to the following SAP Help Portal documentation and Fiori apps:

  • Project Settlement: This documentation describes the settlement process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Apps for Settlement-SAP Help Public cloud
  • Close Projects App: This app is used by the project manager to formally close projects once all financial requirements, including settlement, have been fulfilled. Close Projects-SAP Help Public cloud

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Configuring SAP Start Step by Step
entry.content:
Dear. @adnanmaqbool ,

you can refer to the Learning Journey "Setting up SAP Mobile Start with SAP S/4HANA on SAP Build Work Zone" , which contains very details step-by-step instructions for this integration scenario. Alternatively, you can also follow the steps listed on SAP Help for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

From your description, it seems you may have missed some steps and your SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system is not fully registered as a Content Provider in SAP Build Work Zone. This is a crucial step to expose the relevant content from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Build Work Zone. After this, you can add the intended business roles to your Business Site in SAP Build Work Zone, effectively making the content available for endusers, that have the required roles assigned.

Only after the content is correctly exposed and configured for SAP Build Work Zone it will appear in SAP Mobile Start. Checking the correctness in SAP Build Work Zone using your Desktop Browser is usually a good first analysis step.

Kind regards,
Thomas

entry.title: Re: How to Configure EAN 13 and EAN 14 Codes with Externa...
entry.content:
Hello @Katalina_Guio 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud , to manage EAN 13 and EAN 14 codes using external number assignment, you should configure the EAN settings as follows:

  1. EAN Category Configuration
    Use the app "Configure EAN Categories" to create or adjust EAN categories. You can define unique IDs (up to 2 characters) for each category, such as EAN 13 or EAN 14, and set categories according to your business needs.
  2. Assignment to Materials
    After you have defined your categories, you can assign the EAN category to materials in the "Manage Material" app under the Basic Data section. This way, materials can have multiple EAN codes per unit of measure, with the EAN category controlling validation and format.
  3. External Number Assignment
    For external number assignment of EANs, you have the possibility to maintain the EAN codes directly during material creation or via extension fields. The system validates the format according to the EAN category's settings but respects externally assigned numbers instead of generating numbers internally.
  4. Number Ranges
    Number ranges for EANs are handled via the EAN category's configuration. You cannot directly define traditional SAP number ranges for EANs in Public Cloud but rather validate input against the category's format and structure.
  5. Material Type Impact
    EAN assignment is generally not controlled by material type but by the EAN category assigned to each EAN number. The material's basic data includes the relevant EAN codes rather than depending on the material type configuration.

Below you will find details of where to configure or maintain

  1. Maintain Settings for GTINs
    • Go to app Manage Your Solution (SSCUI).
    • Configuration activity: 104183 Define Number Ranges for International Article Numbers.
    • Here you can define external number ranges for GTINs.
    • You need to decide if the number range is external (you enter EAN manually) or internal.
  2. Assign GTINs to Materials
    • Use Change Material (Manage Product Master Data).
    • Go to Units of Measure tab --> section EANs/GTINs.
    • Enter the GTIN (EAN-13 or EAN-14) for each unit of measure for example base unit, sales unit and carton.
  3. Number Range Assignment
    • GTINs are managed centrally, not per material type.
    • Once you have defined the number ranges in SSCUI 104183, you can enter EANs manually when maintaining materials.

This approach aligns with standard SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud extensibility and configuration capabilities related to EAN management.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issue with Creating External Number Ranges in S/4HANA...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you cannot directly create alphanumeric number ranges (e.g., G001–G999). If you attempt this, the system enforces numeric-only values and raises error NR560: Specify numeric interval limits.

This is by design:

  • Starter systems allow direct alphanumeric input, but customizing/production-like Cloud systems enforce stricter standards.
  • The supported approach in Cloud is to define a numeric interval (e.g., 0001–0999) and then use the Prefix logic (via the “Prefix” flag and customizing object) so that the generated numbers appear as G001–G999.

References:

  • 3368021 - Alphanumeric Number Range for Business Partners in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • 3312172 - Business Partner Alphanumeric External Number Range Errors in SAP S/4HANA Cloud - SAP for Me

In short, you can’t replicate Starter behavior directly, but you can still achieve the same output using numeric intervals with a prefix in S/4HANA Cloud.

Kind regards,

SAP Support

Machine Translation:

你好 @えｑ 

在SAP S/4HANA云公共版中的自定义CDS视图里，PurchaseOrderItem字段是字符串类型（例如“00010”、“00020”），因此直接使用MAX()函数会将其视为文本字符串而非数字。这导致计算出的最大值可能与预期数值不符。

解决方案：

聚合前转换为整数

在自定义CDS视图中，可使用如下表达式：

CAST( PurchaseOrderItem AS abap.int4 )

随后对转换后的数值字段应用MAX()函数。

此方式将“00020”视为20而非字符串。

使用语义数据源

若自定义CDS视图基于已发布的数据源I_PurchaseOrderItem，可创建关联或投影，通过计算字段将PurchaseOrderItem转换为整数。

随后在聚合节点中使用该计算字段。

自定义CDS视图应用程序的替代方案（关键用户）

在自定义CDS视图Fiori应用中，无法自由编写CAST语句。

替代方案：创建计算字段：

数据类型：整数
表达式：字符串转数值（如NUMC或Integer）
在聚合操作（MAX）中使用该计算字段。

此致
Chris

entry.title: Re: Software Component (Partner Demo Development Tenant)...
entry.content:
Hello @Abdurrezzak 

Thank you for your question. I will offer a clear and precise clarification about your development environment and how to create a software component.

The issue you are experiencing is specific to the type of system you are using. The Partner Demo Development Tenant (TDD) has certain limitations that prevent the creation of new software components. This is intentional, as these tenants are configured for demonstration purposes rather than full-scale product development.

As the SAP Knowledge Base Article you referenced explains, your system is restricted to two predefined components: ZPARTNER for multi-offering development and ZLOCAL.

Recommended Course of Action

To continue your development, you should utilise the existing ZPARTNER software component. This component is specifically designed for developing multitenant SaaS products within this environment. Using it will not cause problems when offering your product in the future.

Once your development is complete, you will use the Landscape Portal to create a product that bundles your solution for deployment to other systems and customers’ accounts.

Useful SAP Key References

For your reference, here are the official SAP resources that confirm this information:

SAP KBA 3530333: This article directly addresses the error you encountered and explains the limitations specific to your tenant.

Manage Software Components: This SAP Help Portal documentation outlines the application used for software component lifecycle management. SAP Help-Manage Software Components

Software Component Lifecycle Management: For a broader understanding of the development concepts. SAP Help-Software Component Lifecycle Management

Please let us know if you have any further questions.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Custom Attributes My Inbox
entry.content:
Hi @Erwan_Prigent @eliasfelipedasilva1999 

To customize the Task View in the My Inbox app for Purchase Order release to display additional fields like Gross Amount in either new columns or under the existing Custom Attributes columns (Custom Attributes 1 to 6), here is the recommended approach for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

Key Points and Steps

  1. Custom Attributes Configuration (SSCUI 106664 Maintain CDS Based Custom Attributes)
    • You can add new columns to display fields from CDS views related to your tasks.
    • Standard fields like Supplier Name and Purchase Order Date are available and can be assigned as custom attributes.
    • Custom attributes correspond to CDS view fields, so to display a field such as Gross Amount, it must be exposed in the underlying CDS view bound to the task.
  2. Adding Non-Standard Fields (e.g., Gross Amount)
    • If "Gross Amount" is not available in the standard CDS used by the My Inbox for Purchase Order release tasks, you cannot directly add it through SSCUI 106664.
    • The recommended practice is to work with SAP delivered enhancement spots or extension points to enhance the CDS view behind the workflow task to expose additional fields.
    • This requires development (ABAP CDS view extension) typically handled by key-users or developers authorized in the cloud system.
  3. Limitations without SAP Business Workflow Access
    • Since you do not have SAP Business Workflow, options for deep workflow customization are limited. However, custom CDS extension and configuring custom attributes via SSCUI remain possible if allowed in your cloud edition.
    • The custom attributes configured appear in the “Information” tab and can also be shown as columns in the Expert View of My Inbox.
  4. Below are some additional info and documentation links
    • Display Custom Attributes in My Inbox explains custom attributes usage and SAP reserved IDs for certain attributes.
    • 2769263 - How to enhance My Inbox app with custom fields
    • Define Custom Attributes (Dynamic Columns) for SAP Business Workflow Tasks   

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Launching My Custom SAPUI5 App in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @marceloromeiro 

I understand the frustration; it's a typical source of confusion when moving to the public cloud.

The behaviour you're seeing is the correct and intended process in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. You cannot directly create a launchpad tile and then assign it to a custom business catalogue as you might in an on-premises system.

Possible Solution

The correct approach is to use the dedicated Fiori apps for managing catalogues and roles.

Add the App to a Custom Business Catalogue: First, you must add your new app to an existing custom business catalogue. Use the Manage Business Catalogues Fiori app for this step. Your custom catalogue should be accessible here.

Assign the Catalogue to a Business Role: After adding your app to the custom catalogue, ensure this catalogue is assigned to the appropriate business role for your users.

Your custom app won't be visible in the list of available tiles until it's properly linked to a custom catalogue, which in turn must be assigned to a business role.

Key References

Here are some official resources that will guide you through this process:

  • Custom Tiles Fiori App: The app's documentation describes how to create the tile. https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F2994')/S31
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Guide: This offers a comprehensive overview of the process, from development to Fiori Launchpad integration. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/16b1df7ce64b4bef98071fde8e716332.html

This should resolve the issue and enable your app to be launched correctly by users with the appropriate business role.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP PUBLIC CLOUD ABAP EML Defintion
entry.content:
Hello,

Sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content.) solves the issue?

To define the type for creating a table corresponding to the content in %target when using the BOI operation process and components of the production order, you need to ensure that the fields in %target are correctly mapped to the entity’s attributes. Here is a breakdown of the code:

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_productionordertp
ENTITY productionorderoperation [APIs for Manufacturing - Production Order Operations](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/d35113ee62644d3abee1aaec148291d9/7cc3f670f45243709dc038ef3ee0a443.html)
CREATE BY _operationcomponent
AUTO FILL CID
FIELDS ( material
         billofmaterialitemcategory
         requiredquantity
         baseunit )
WITH VALUE #(
     ( %key-orderinternalid = '0000001161'
       %key-orderoperationinternalid = '00000001'
       %target = VALUE #(
       ( material = |{ '2' ALPHA = IN WIDTH = 18 }|
         %data-billofmaterialitemcategory [APIs for Manufacturing - Production Order Components Using RAP BO](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/d35113ee62644d3abee1aaec148291d9/1b599045b0664da89f7728055e75f81c.html) = 'L'
         %data-requiredquantity = 22
         %data-baseunit = 'KG'
         %data-StorageLocation = '131A' )
                        )
     )
            )
FAILED DATA(failed)
REPORTED DATA(reported)
MAPPED DATA(mapped).

Explanation:

  • MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_productionordertp: This line specifies the CDS view or entity you are modifying.
  • ENTITY productionorderoperation: This specifies the entity within the CDS view that you are working with.
  • CREATE BY _operationcomponent: This indicates that you are creating new entries based on the operation component.
  • FIELDS: Lists the fields you want to populate in the new entries.
  • WITH VALUE: Provides the values for the fields listed.
  • %key-orderinternalid and %key-orderoperationinternalid: These are keys that uniquely identify the production order and operation.
  • %target: This is where you define the values for the fields you are creating. Ensure that each field in %target corresponds to a field in the entity.

Make sure that the fields in %target are correctly mapped to the entity’s attributes and that the data types match the expected types in the CDS view.

[1] APIs for Manufacturing - Production Order Operations
[2] APIs for Manufacturing - Production Order Components Using RAP BO

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Change PO Delivery address output in SAP Adobe form i...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

To implement the solution where the Purchase Order Output Header Ship-to Address is hidden and displayed at the line item level only if any line item has a different address, you can follow these steps:

Steps to Implement

  1. Access the Form Template:

    • Use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system to access the form template for the Purchase Order.
    • Navigate to the ‘Maintain Form Templates’ app under the ‘Output Management’ tile.
    • Download the pre-delivered template MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER.

  2. Modify the Form Template:

    • Open the downloaded form template using Adobe LiveCycle Designer.
    • Locate the section where the Ship-to Address is printed at the header level.
    • Implement logic to hide this section if any line item has a different Ship-to Address.

  3. Implement Custom Logic:

    • Use the Form Data Provider Service (FDP) managed by SAP to control the data visibility on the form.
    • Implement custom logic in the form template to check each line item’s Ship-to Address.
    • If all line items have the same address, print the address at the header level; otherwise, print the address at the line item level.

  4. Upload the Modified Template:

    • After making the necessary changes, upload the modified template back into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system using the ‘Maintain Form Templates’ app.

  5. Test the Implementation:

    • Generate a Purchase Order output to verify that the Ship-to Address is correctly hidden at the header level and displayed at the line item level as per the requirement.

Additional Notes

  • Ensure that the custom logic is correctly implemented to handle different scenarios of line item addresses.
  • You may need to consult with your SAP administrator or developer to ensure the changes align with your system’s configuration and requirements.

For more detailed guidance, refer to SAP Note 3025164 - Purchase Order Output Header Ship-to Address. 3025164 - Purchase Order Output Header Ship-to Address

[1] 3025164 - Purchase Order Output Header Ship-to Address

Kind regards, Henrike

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the customer code defaults to 10 digits. However, it is not possible to extend the customer code beyond this default length through standard configuration. The system has technical restrictions that limit the length of certain fields, such as customer codes, to predefined values. If you need a longer code, you might need to consider alternative approaches, such as using additional fields or custom logic to accommodate your requirements.

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Custom Analytical Query with navigation
entry.content:
Hello,

To make the amount clickable like a hotspot Solved: ‘Jump to’ function in Custom Analytical Query - SAP Community in a custom Analytical Query using CDS view annotations in SAP Public Cloud, you can use the ‘Jump to’ function. This function allows you to navigate from one application to another by clicking on a specific field, such as the amount in your query.

Steps to Implement ‘Jump to’ Function:

  1. Define the CDS View: Ensure your CDS view is properly defined with the necessary annotations.
  2. Create the Analytical Query: Use the ‘Custom Analytical Queries’ app to create your query based on the CDS view.
  3. Configure the ‘Jump to’ Function: In the query design, you can set up navigation targets for specific fields. This involves defining the target application and the parameters to pass.

Example:

Suppose you have a field ‘Amount’ in your query. You can configure it to navigate to a detailed transaction view when clicked.

Considerations:

  • Ensure the target application supports navigation from the analytical query.
  • Test the navigation to ensure it works as expected.

For more detailed guidance, you can refer to SAP resources or community discussions on implementing navigation in analytical queries.

[1] Solved: 'Jump to' function in Custom Analytical Query - SAP Community

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: When entering stock and non stock item in order cost...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

When entering stock and non-stock items in a maintenance order, you are experiencing an issue where the cost is being updated in one category, YB2, instead of being split between YB2 for stock items and YB3 for non-stock items. This issue may be related to the configuration of the material type ERSA or the assignment of cost element groups.

Possible Solutions:

  1. Check Material Type Configuration:

    • Ensure that the material type ERSA is correctly configured to differentiate between stock and non-stock items. This may involve checking the valuation class and account assignment settings.

  2. Review Cost Element Group Assignments:

    • Verify that the cost element groups YB2 and YB3 are correctly assigned Non-Time Related Materials for Project Services - SAP Community to the respective stock and non-stock items. This can be done by checking the DIP profile settings, which determine how costs are posted based on material types and account assignments.

  3. Adjust DIP Profile Settings:

    • The Dynamic Item Processing (DIP) profile may need adjustments to ensure that costs are correctly categorized. Ensure that the DIP profile rules are set to differentiate Service - Procurement of Non-Stock Service Parts between stock and non-stock items based on their account assignment.
[1] Non-Time Related Materials for Project Services - SAP Community
[2] Service - Procurement of Non-Stock Service Parts
Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Managed with additional save with full data implemena...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

It seems like the issue you’re facing is related to the persistence of data in your custom table. Here are a few suggestions to troubleshoot and resolve the problem:

1. Transaction Handling

Ensure that the transaction is properly committed after the update operation. If the transaction is not committed, the changes might not be saved permanently.

COMMIT ENTITIES.

2. Check for Errors

Verify if there are any errors reported during the MODIFY ENTITIES operation. You can check the lt_failed and lt_reported tables for any error messages.

3. Debugging

Use debugging tools to step through the code and check the values being processed. Ensure that the values are correctly assigned and updated.

4. Behavior Definition

Ensure that the behavior definition is correctly set up to handle updates. The behavior definition should include the necessary operations for updating the entity.

5. Save Method

In the save_modified method, ensure that the logic for updating the database is correctly implemented. Double-check the logic for appending and updating the table.

6. Data Consistency

Check if there are any other processes or logic that might be overwriting or deleting the data after it is saved.

If these steps do not resolve the issue, consider reviewing the entire process flow and logic to identify any discrepancies or errors. ABAP Restful Application Programming Model (RAP), … - SAP Community

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Project Billing making the billing documents more det...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

To create more detailed billing documents in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for professional services projects, you can utilize the ‘Manage Project Billing’ app. This app allows you to prepare billing documents with detailed information from the work package. Here are some steps and features you can use to achieve this:

Steps to Create Detailed Billing Documents

  1. Access the Manage Project Billing App: Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Navigate to the ‘Manage Project Billing’ app where you can see all the billing elements associated with your projects.

  2. Prepare Billing: During the preparation of billing, you can view and manage individual items within the work package. This includes time confirmations, expenses, and other cost postings.

  3. Write-Off and Postpone: You can choose to write-off or postpone specific items, which allows you to manage what gets included in the billing document.

  4. Add Additional Items: You can add, edit, or delete additional items in the project billing request, which helps in creating a more detailed billing document.

  5. Use Preliminary Billing Documents: Before finalizing the billing document, you can use preliminary billing documents to make further adjustments and ensure all details are captured.

Features for Detailed Billing

  • Flexible Material Determination: Configure flexible material determination Understand and influence data preparation behind Project Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to ensure that all relevant materials and activity types are included in the billing.
  • Approval Workflow: Implement an approval workflow for project billing requests to ensure all details are reviewed before finalizing the billing document.
  • Detailed Reporting: Utilize the reporting capabilities to track and manage detailed billing data.

By following these steps and utilizing the features available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you can create billing documents that provide a comprehensive view of all items within a work package, enhancing transparency and accuracy in billing processes.

[1] Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
[2] Understand and influence data preparation behind Project Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Kind regards, 
Henrike

entry.title: Re: how to make an Optional inspection characteristic Req...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

To achieve the requirement where a Master Inspection Characteristic (MIC) marked as optional becomes required after a certain number of inspection lots, you can utilize the concept of Dynamic Modification in inspection plans.

Dynamic Modification

Dynamic modification allows you to flexibly change the inspection scope Quality Management - Dynamic Modification in Inspection Plans based on past valuations. You can assign dynamic modification rules at different levels, such as:

  • Inspection Type Level
  • Inspection Lot Level
  • Characteristic Level

For your requirement, you can use dynamic modification at the Characteristic Level. This involves setting a modification rule that updates the inspection stage based on the number of inspection lots.

Steps to Implement

  1. Define Dynamic Modification Rule: Create a dynamic modification rule that specifies when the MIC should change from optional to required.
  2. Assign Rule to Characteristic: In the inspection plan, assign this rule to the MIC at the characteristic level.
  3. Monitor Inspection Lots: The system will automatically update the inspection stage of the MIC based on the rule, making it required after the specified number of inspection lots.

This approach ensures that the MIC becomes mandatory for recording results after the defined number of inspection lots, thus preventing the completion of the usage decision without recording results for it.

For more detailed information, you can refer to the SAP documentation on Dynamic Modification in Inspection Plans.

[1] Quality Management - Dynamic Modification in Inspection Plans

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Modify existing custom Fiori App
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply:

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves the issue?

To modify an existing custom Fiori app using RAP in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS), you need to load the project into BAS. Here are the steps you can follow:

Steps to Load the Project into BAS

  1. Access the SAP System: First, ensure you have access to the SAP system where the app is deployed.

  2. Download the App Source Code: If the app was deployed using the Multi-Target Application (MTA) approach, you can download the source code from the SAP system. This might involve accessing the Git repository if the project was version-controlled.

  3. Create a New Project in BAS: SAP S/4HANA Extensibility Options For Clean Core Journey

    • Open SAP Business Application Studio. SAP Fiori App Development with RAP and SAP BTP Tools
    • Use the ‘New Project from Template’ option to create a new project.
    • Select the appropriate template that matches the existing app’s structure.

  4. Import the Source Code:

    • Once the project is created, import the downloaded source code into the BAS workspace.
    • Ensure all dependencies and configurations are correctly set up.

  5. Modify the UI:

    • Navigate to the UI components within the project.
    • Add the custom action as required.

  6. Deploy the Modified App:

    • Build the project using the BAS build tools.
    • Deploy the updated application back to the SAP system.

Additional Considerations

  • Version Control: If the project was under version control, ensure you have the latest version before making changes.
  • Testing: Thoroughly test the application after modifications to ensure functionality is as expected.

By following these steps, you should be able to load the project into BAS, make the necessary UI modifications, and redeploy the app.

[1] SAP S/4HANA Extensibility Options For Clean Core Journey
[2] SAP Fiori App Development with RAP and SAP BTP Tools
Kind regards,
Henrike

entry.title: Re: SAP CAP action with Unstructured/Dynamic Type Input
entry.content:
The example provided in your file has the additional property inside "input" object, whereas the requirement that I stated was to have the additional property at root node. @open isn't allowing to have additional property within root node.

Using your file as an example, I need to be able to pass input payload as follows without mapping errors:

{
  "input": {
    "field1": 123,
    "field2": "Value"
  }
  "newfield": "newvalue"  // ✅ No mapping error 
}

Update:
The direction you provided to use @open was helpful. I was able to achieve the requirement by adding the keyword before action.

@open action MyAction(input : object) returns object;

This allowed the action to take in unknown names at root level.
